intro: Cleidion mannii, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The tree produces small, fleshy fruits that are yellow when ripe, containing a single seed. It is often valued for its hard, heavy wood, which is used in furniture and construction. Cleidion mannii prefers well-drained soils and is commonly found in moist, shaded habitats in the understory of forests.
